content.question:
Researchers studying starfish collected two independent random samples of 40 starfish. One sample came from an ocean area in the north, and the other sample came from an ocean area in the south. Of the 40 starfish from the north, 6 were found to be over 8 inches in length. Of the 40 starfish from the south, 11 were found to be over 8 inches in length.
Which of the following is the test statistic for the appropriate test to investigate whether there is a difference in proportion of starfish over 8 inches in length in the two ocean areas (north minus south) ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 6 minus 11 over the square root of the fraction 6 over 40 plus the fraction 11 over 40, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 6 minus 11 over the square root of the fraction, 0.15 over 40, plus the fraction 0.275 over 40, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.15</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.275</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.15 minus 0.275 over the square root of 0.15 times 0.275 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 40 plus the fraction one of over 40, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.275</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.15</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.275</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.15 minus 0.0275 over the square root of 0.2125 times 0.7875 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 40 plus the fraction 1 of over 40, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.275</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.2125</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.7875</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.15 minus 0.275 over 0.2125 times 0.7875 times the square root of the fraction 1 over 40 plus the fraction 1 over 40, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.275</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.2125</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.7875</mn><mo>)</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 0.15 minus 0.0275 over the square root of 0.2125 times 0.7875 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over 40 plus the fraction 1 of over 40, close parenthesis, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.275</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.2125</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.7875</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.11: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
